Local news headlines contradict the clai: stating that passengers escaped death in the bus crash.
Radio Mano: a community radio station, reported on the event after visiting Kasama General Hospital and interviewing the bus conductor, who provided details about the accident.
Humphrey Chanda: the medical superintendent at Kasama General Hospital, confirmed that there were no fatalities and provided information on the number of injured individuals treated.
The bus company: Power Tools Logistics, did not release any statement regarding the incident on their social media accounts, and a phone call to the company confirmed that there were no fatalities in the crash.
